flawed_nl_solution:
Twice the number of participants in 2018 is 150 participants x 2 = <<150*2=300>>300 participants.
The number of participants in 2019 was 300 participants + 20 participants = <<300+20=302>>302 participants.
Half the number of participants in 2019 is 302 participants /2 = <<302/2=151>>151 participants.
The number of participants in 2020 was 151 participants - 40 participants = <<151-40=111>>111 participants.
There were 302 participants - 111 participants = <<302-111=191>>191 more participants in 2019 than in 2020.
#### 191

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 320, not 302. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
